    • Method Detail

      • getResources

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<ResourceType>> getResources(int diceRoll)
                                                                    throws InvalidDiceRollException
        Gives resources out to players
        Parameters:
        diceRoll - int In the range of 2 to 12, excluding 7
        Returns:
        A map of resources to give to each player
        Throws:
        InvalidDiceRollException - Throws exception if diceRoll is less than 2 or greater than 12 or equal to 7

      • canInitiateSettlement

        boolean canInitiateSettlement(int playerIndex,
                              VertexLocation vertexLoc)
                       throws InvalidPlayerException,
                              InvalidLocationException
        Informs if a Settlement can be initiated at a vertex location
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - int
        vertexLoc - VertexLocation
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        InvalidPlayerException - Throws exception if playerIndex is invalid
        InvalidLocationException - Throws exception if vertex location is not on the map

      • initiateSettlement

        java.util.List<ResourceType> initiateSettlement(int playerIndex,
                                                VertexLocation vertexLoc)
                                         throws StructureException,
                                                InvalidLocationException,
                                                InvalidPlayerException
        Builds a Settlement in setup phase and gives out resources if it is the players second turn
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - int
        vertexLoc - VertexLocation
        Returns:
        A list of resources to give to the player
        Throws:
        StructureException - Throws exception if the Settlement can't be built at the vertex location
        InvalidLocationException - Throws exception if vertex location is not on the map
        InvalidPlayerException - Throws exception if playerIndex is invalid

      • canInitiateRoad

        boolean canInitiateRoad(int playerIndex,
                        EdgeLocation edgeLoc)
                 throws InvalidPlayerException,
                        InvalidLocationException
        Informs if a road can be initiated at an edge location if connected to a vertex location
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - int
        edgeLoc - EdgeLocation
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        InvalidPlayerException - Throws exception if playerIndex is invalid
        InvalidLocationException - Throws exception if Edge/Vertex locaiton is not on the map

      • moveRobber

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> moveRobber(int playerIndex,
                                            HexLocation hexLoc)
                                     throws AlreadyRobbedException,
                                            InvalidLocationException
        Moves the Robber to a new hex location
        Parameters:
        hexLoc - HexLocation
        Returns:
        A set of playerIndex that can be robbed
        Throws:
        AlreadyRobbedException - Throws exception if Robber is moved to where it is already at
        InvalidLocationException - Throws exception if vertex location is not on the map

      • deleteRoad

        void deleteRoad(int playerIndex,
                EdgeLocation edgeLoc)
         throws InvalidLocationException,
                StructureException
        Deletes a road if a player cancels in the middle of the play road building card
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - int
        edgeLoc - EdgeLocation
        Throws:
        InvalidLocationException - throws exception if edge locaiton is not on the map
        StructureException - throws exception if edge location doesn't have a road to delete
